39527951.review:
Минималистский резкий раннер. Якобы про коллайдер.

[h1]Почему это не коллайдер…[/h1]

1) Стенки вакуумной камеры ускорителя не светятся — я туда неоднократно заглядывал.

2) Внутри нет никаких подвижных элементов — когда я туда заглядывал всё было приварено в усмерть.

3) Если бы стенки и светились, то с увеличением скорости спектр смещался бы в сторону ультрафиолета и далее жёсткого рентгена. Ну и выглядело бы всё не так, так как мы набегаем на фотоны, то есть углы падения становятся более параллельные нашему движению (да, да, в Звёздных войнах всё показывается не так — до прыжка звёзды должны сбегаться в переднюю точку на экране).

4) Моей реакции хватает только до скорости 1000. Не понятно 1000 чего? Скорость протонов в LHC (Большой адронный коллайдер) отличается от скорости света на меньше чем миллионную долю процента, которая в свою очередь равна 299792458 м/c.

5) Разгоняемой частице нет необходимости прокладывать свой курс — её в дыры ускорительной структуры пропихивают фокусирующие магнитные поля.

[h1]Чем это похоже на полёт заряженной частицы  в коллайдере[/h1]
Рано или поздно её бег заканчивается. Либо на стенке из-за внутрипучкового рассеяния (Эффект Тушека), либо просто потому что коллайдер выключили, либо (для чего всё это затевается) из-за жёсткого взаимодействия с частицей из встречного пучка.

[h1]Геймплей[/h1]
Следите за белой точкой и размещайте её в дырке налетающей стенки. Быстрая реакция крайне желательна.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]
В игре есть баг, связанный с русской локалью. Если вы просто запустите игру, то обнаружите, что мышь и клавиатура не определяется, то есть даже стартовать не получится. Для ликвидации проблемы в параметрах запуска игры (правая кнопка мышки на названии игры в оболочке Steam → Properties → Set Launch Options) следует прописать: 
[code]
LC_ALL=C %command%
[/code]
Решение взято [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/319550/discussions/0/616188677818738624/]отсюда[/url]. В остальном на ноутбуке с Ubuntu 16.04 никаких проблем не было.

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры[/url].[/h1]

36031642.review:
This is a bare-bones clone of a free Kongregate web game called Accelerator. Accelerator is one of my favorite games. It's absurdly fast, challenging, and fun. I haven't made it to 1400 speed in Accelerator yet, but I will one day. I just played The Collider for the first time, thinking it would have more features than its free predecessor. Instead, I beat it in under 20 minutes. This game has worse pop-in than Accelerator. This game is slower than Accelerator. This game has far fewer obstacles than Accelerator. You never have to turn, only make microscopic adjustments. You can cheese your way through any level by buying continues with coin pickups.

Do yourself a favor. Close steam and go play Accelerator.

35576717.review:
"The Collider" ist ein kleines Casual-Geschicklichkeits-Reaktions-Spiel.

Wie fühlt man sich wohl als Teilchen im Beschleuniger LHC (Large Hadron Collider) des CERN. Wie in einer Röhre, die einen immer mehr beschleunigt. Genau das ist die (sicherlich nicht realistisch umgesetzte) Prämisse dieses Spielchens. Wir werden in einer bunten Röhre immer mehr beschleunigt und müssen bei auf uns zukommenden Wänden, den Spalt finden, der uns nicht kollidieren läßt. 

Das Ganze ist bunt, aber graphisch klar und kommt mit einer erstaunlich guten, pumpend antreibenden Musik daher. Es ist so simpel wie es sein kann. Andere Spielmodi oder sonstige Abwechslung sucht man vergebens. Das macht aber nichts, denn das Eine, worauf sich das Spiel konzentriert, stimmt einfach. In Bezug auf Pacing, Design und Geschwindigkeitsgefühl ist es eines der besten des Wir-fallen-kontinuierlich-werden-immer-schneller-und-müssen-ausweichen-Genres. Mehr braucht es nicht, um gut zu sein.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
7/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Zur aktiven Erzeugung von Higgs-Teilchen.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

При том, что игра мне нравится, и я написала положительный отзыв, рекомендовать я её больше не могу. Рейтинг в игре не работает, разработчики слились, а играть в соревновательную игру без рейтинга - стало совсем не интересно. 

***

В эту игру мне предложил поиграть друг - хотел проверить мою реакцию. Реакция оказалась лучше чем у него, а игра зацепила. Теперь он её давно забросил, а я всё играю, с каждый разом доходя до всё больших скоростей. Нравится мне в этой игрушке всё - и красивый гипнотизирующий "туннель", и встроенная музыка. А ещё постоянный вызов себе. Сначала кажется что никогда не дойдёшь до "вот этой" скорости, потом покоряешь её и идёшь дальше и дальше.

По сути игра состоит из двух этапов. На первом, начальном, нужно добраться до скорости 1300, собрав по пути все ачивки. На втором, начиная со скорости 1300, улететь как можно дальше, попав в десятку (а лучше в тройку) таблицы рекордов и получив бонус монеток (новый розыгрыш каждую неделю)

22111260.review:
The Collider is a simple, yet unique game that "puts your reflexes to the test."  It's a fast paced arcade type of game that takes place inside a particle accelerator and you will have to go through obstacles to pass the test.

I'm not going to go into many details, but The Collider is a fast paced game, and I mean a very fast paced game. The levels will progressively get harder and you will accelerate faster and faster towards the obstacles, giving you less time to maneuver them and will challenge your reflex skills.

The controls are very simple, you just use your mouse to move the particle around and avoid the obstacles. It also has some controller support so that is a plus.

The achievements can be easy to get, you'll most likely get them all within an hour or so. The leaderboard is also a very nice feature to have, you can try to beat your friends' score and it gives you a purpose to keep going further than usual. The music is really decent as you play it, I like it. :)

And let's not forget about the trading cards. ;)

All in all, it is enjoyable and yet, challenging at the same time. You won't get very far at first, but you know what they say: "Practice makes perfect."


[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
I'd say you should. If you are looking for a challenge or some relaxing fun then yes, you should. It's worth the small price. Or you can just wait for a sale to happen if that's your style.

7.5/10

21330590.review:
[h1] Preview - What is The Collider? [/h1]

The Collider is that old acrade-styled game transformed into something new. You may of played something similar to this before some time in your life. You are falling and you must go through the holes and pass 10 levels to complete the game. While this does sound plain and simple, it's not as easy as it sounds. Levels 1-5 are easy, however as levels go on it gets harder and harder to the point where it is insane to keep up.

But what makes this game stand out? Why this game rather than other games like this game? First, the graphics are so colorful and energy-like that makes it stand out. The music at first may sound plain but then it get's better to the point where it is in your head for a very very long time. But that's only some of what this game has to offer. Let me show you some pros and cons to help you understand why this game is so good:

[h1] Pros [/h1]
[list]
[*] Energy-like graphics
[*] Great music
[*] Steam achievements!
[*] Steam trading cards!
[*] Cheap!
[*] Leaderboard!
[*] Coin system!
[/list]
[h1] Cons [/h1]
[list]
[*] Game-breaking bugs (cheating bug)
[*] Short game
[/list]

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

The Collider is a great upgrade to those acrade games you played as a kid. There is more pros than cons within this game. There is little to nothing wrong with this game. So...

Does The Collider seem good to you? Buy it then! :D

[b] Overall Rating: 9/10 [/b]

Итак «вы находитесь близ Женевы, на границе Швейцарии и Франции»; вас поместили в «закольцованную трубу»; вы адрон – тяжелая частица, состоящая из кварков; и вас перманентно ускоряют до тех пор, пока вы не столкнётесь c препятствием.

Игра стоила мне ~8руб, по купону со скидкой 90%.. Одна карточка продается за 13-29руб. Еврей, в глубине моей души, несказанно рад. Почему в глубине? Потому что я все равно хочу этот значок.

Что по сути: смысл игры до гениальности прост. Вы - маленькая частица в адронном коллайдере, которую бесконечно разгоняют. Цель - не врезаться в диски на вашем пути, пролетая сквозь отверстия в них. В игре 24 ачивмента. 12 из низ вы получаете за каждое достижение скорости кратной 100, от 200 до 1300 включительно. Остальные 12 выдаются за прохождение каждого отрезка, без столкновения с диском. Интерфейс красивый, простой и понятный. Сама игра яркая, насыщенные цвета, но от буйства красок глаза не кровоточат. Саундтрек отлично подходит к геймплею. 20568487.review:
Great game for the price. I recceived a coupon after badge creation and ended up being deeply discounted. Most smaller games like this, I simply tend to write off as shovelware. I keep coming back to play The Collider for it's sheer simplicity, challenege and overall fun.

Who is this game for? It's primarily best for those who want to develop better hand-eye coordination, with speed and complexity increasing as the game rolls along. It's a good fit for those who want to test the accuracy of their mouse and it's settings for FPSs and the like. Those who get off on  high scores and perfection in beating a game would beneift from this game. Lastly, whomever has had a fleeting thought of what it would be like to be a particle in a massive collider shuld try it. The concept is great and it's the imagination the developers had that puts it to good form.

Soundtrack is simple, consisting of two songs, on the main menu and in-game. It's great and effective, adding tension at the correct times. Who knew speed could considered within the horror genre?

My only caveat is that the acheivements are glitched and the developers have no intention of fixing them, ever. The awards unlock after exiting the game and sometimes do not register, especially when going for the Perfect Score acheivements. Not a major issue, but it will annoy the acheivement hunterts out there.

Overall, The Collider is worth your time, especially when on sale or if you're lucky and get a coupon like I did.

僅か14分にて全実績解除に至ったためレビュー。Ver.は不明。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][List]
[*]シンプルなルール
[*]Steam、Android、iOSのクロスプラットフォームスコアランキング対応
[*]あっという間に解除される実績
[*]ゲーム性に適したサウンドトラック[/List]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][List]
[*]バッジを全て集めるなら時間がかかる[/List]

[h1]時折エイムコントロールや反応速度を確かめるのに有用なアプリ[/h1]

　ゲームのルールは他の方が既に語っておられるように単純明快で高速スクロールする壁の穴を通過するだけです。速度はだんだん速くなり、壁にぶつかっても3回まではゲーム内通貨を支払うことで復帰できます。最終的に到達した速度がそのままスコアとなり、スコアはAndroidやiOSとのクロスプラットフォームランキングとなっている模様です。

　スタート時の速度設定で指定した速度がそのままノーミスでの速度達成実績解除となるため、実績自体は1300の速度に到達した時点で必然的に全実績解除となります。実績解除が好きな方には問答無用でオススメできます。

　Android 100円、iOS 120円、Steam 298円と価格としては1番高くなっていますが、タッチ操作のスマートフォンデバイスに対しマウスによる操作の優位性なのかランキング上位はSteam勢が陣取っていました。プレイ用途としてはFPSなど高速でマウス操作を行うジャンルをプレイする前のウォーミングアップに適していると言えます。アドレナリン分泌用にどうぞ。

The Collider — футуристичная аркадная игра.

Цель игрока — мчаться на космическом корабле в огромном коллайдере с нарастающей скоростью, пролетая сквозь отверстия в преградах. В некоторых из отверстий находятся монеты, желательно их собирать. Направление движения корабля показано маленькой точкой.

Скорость движения постоянно увеличивается — на первом уровне до ста километров в час, а на последнем — до 1300, добраться до финала за один заход почти нереально. Если достичь определенной скорости, она разблокирует новый уровень, и в дальнейшем игру можно будет начинать сразу с него.

Игра продолжается до первого столкновения корабля с препятствием, но затем можно восстановиться за монеты или просмотр рекламного видео. Больше трех раз восстанавливаться не дают.

Игра на самом деле очень классная, всем рекомендую.

19539294.review:
The Collider is an exhilerating Indie title in which you navigate through a tunnel at an increasing speed while trying to make it through the same type of obstacle -- the infamous rotating vertical disc with a hole in it. Spooky.

If you played Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc and partook in the Missile Command minigame, this should feel familiar to you. You're essentially guiding a camera through a series of conveniently placed rotating discs with holes in them. The holes differ in size and shape, which I find to be challenging yet rewarding. As time progresses, the speed at which you're zooming by increases exponentially with each interval (every time the counter reaches 100, to be exact). If you're appreciative of pretty colors, you're in for quite the treat here -- there are a [i]lot[/i] of them.

The soundtrack in the game is an upbeat electronic motivator. It makes the entire experience a bit more exciting, though it does get old as you continue playing. Hearing the same song over and over again typically doesn't bode well if it doesn't resonate with its listener, surprisingly enough. Still, though -- it's a tune I certainly wanted to dance to at one point.

If you're looking for a euphoric graphical experience, you've come to the wrong place. You can see for yourself in the screenshots provided on the game's store page.

The only indication that you're finished with the game would have to be the achievements. I'm not too keen on my champion status (the game includes a leaderboard), and as such, the game is finished for me once I've acquired all of the achievements available for me to earn.

The only issue I've found within the game is that at a certain point, your crosshair is simply too large. I often found myself struggling to see where the hole was because of it. It's easily remedied by proper peripheral vision, though.

Definitely worth the price. I bought it while it was on sale for a few cents, I'd advise you to do the same.

Oh, and don't blink.

19497872.review:

19481720.review:
its a steam card game, so objectively there's no reason to bash on it, after all its free money for most people who got this on giveaways.
however here's the things wrong with the game.
-achievements in this game are far too easy to collect, i bet i would have gotten all of them if i had played this game when i was 5. what's wrong with this? fundamentally, that it rewards users far too much for not doing much of anything. destroys the feeling of "achieving" something since you get them almost immediately. stops feeling like a reward altogether. (not saying there aren't people who like to just add achievements to their steam list)
-after the first 2 to 4 minutes, you've seen the entire game, no reason to replay it after getting all the cards, even other mobile endless runners have more content than this, and for free.
-cards take far too long to come out for what the game really is, for example.
i felt like i was done with the game after 20 or 30 minutes of play...and i was, in fact the only reason i have 2 hours+ of play is because that's what it took me to get all of my card drops so in reality, i only played half an hour, even if i were to replay i don't think i'd play over an hour of this game before uninstalling.
ultimately having steam trading cards as one of the biggest reasons to get a game is still objectively bad game design and marketing. want proof? the only reason i realised i had this game on my library was because i was browsing my uninstalled games list. after the cards drop, there's no reason to come back, you are done.

I got a coupon earlier today for making a badge. At first, I didn't think much since most coupons are for games that are of poor quality. When I saw the generous 90%, though, i investigated. It is a clever game, resembling one of those old arcade games. The only difference is, you don't have to pay to play again. Its 3 dollers flat, and you can go on and on. No in game purchases to give you boosts, the only boosts you get are the ones you earn in the game. The controls are utterly easy to learn, the senstivity slider is a good implimcation. 19138248.review:
Really short game, putting you inside a kaleidoscope, in role of particle, or beam of light... whatever. I quoted this already, in other review, but I must repeat that sentence: "It is not possible to see of any psychic experience from common physical elements like movement and masses" (E.Mach, Erkenntnis und Irrtum. p.12). Again, I think that Mach was not right in his philosophy, while being a genius in physics.

All this little game, Collider, is about speed. You're accelerating, then accelerating further, and even faster... until finally you meet some obstruction on the way, and game begins anew. And you know what? It appears that I'm afraid of speed! I wasn't so scared while playing Amnesia or strolling through the 100-meter precipice in real life! I can drive my Skoda up to 160 km/h (100 mph for you, Imperials) quite easily, but I was frightened big time while going through that Collider. Certainly, I'm not of Midi-chlorian symbionts, and don't deserve to flight to the Death Star.

Still, I was able to beat this game in one hour for the gold, with all achievements unlocked. And after another hour of idling I got 3 steam cards, each worth quite alot.

So I definitely recommend this game! For one, you can test yourself with the speed, to know your limits, and so on. Second, you getting steam cards which costs almost as much as this game without any discount. That means, if you buy The Collider on sale, or via bundle, you'll even get a profit! And, for third, if you not a victim of tachophobia, you'll get a nice easy full-complete game.

My mark 7/10. Quick game, nice atmosphere of pure speed. Become the wave!

18451907.review: First, I just want to not that I got this game using a 90% Discout Coupon from the Steam Marketplace, so I only pain $0.30 for it. The game is really simple and doesn't have a whole lot to offer, so it probably isn't worth $3.00. But if you can get it for practically nothing, then it's good for killing time. The Steam Trading Cards don't begin dropping until you've logged 2+ hours of play-time, therefore it might take a few play sessions to earn them. What I think can be said about this game, is that navigating the curving corridor and lining your cursor up with each opening could help to hone your First-Person-Shooter reaction times and enemy tracking accuracy. The Leaderboard keeps track of everyones highest obtained speed. Each week, in-game replay coins are awarded to the top 10 players, and then the board resets. This feature does add a little bit of intrigue to the game, you never know when you might make the top 10. I even made 8th myself once. Is your FPS hand fast enough to be number one?

18013932.review:
Basically, this is a casual game where you keep moving a white dot to avoid obstacles. The speed keeps increasing, so the more you hold on, the harder it gets.

To be frank, as said in many other reviews I read before even purchasing, it's really handy if you need to train your reaction skills for a FPS game (I play CS:GO and I do confirm I did improve a bit). Besides, it can help you waste some useless time, if you have any to spare.

However, the music is not that great, only 1 soundtrack looping over and over again. The most annoying thing is how fast things end, at least in my case. I spend less than a minute before having to start from the beginning (or alternatively start at a speed I reached before), which makes for even less time playing.

All in all, it's not bad for killing time, but you may get frustrated at how incompetent you are dodging obstacles at insanely increasing speeds.

17364151.review:
[h1]"Симулятор разгона частиц"[/h1]

Игра проста, как 3 копейки. Есть коллайдер (да-да, игра серьезна) и частица (че там разгоняют в коллайдерах). И всё. Наша задача: не врезаться в...эм...стенки внутри коллайдера, а попадать четко в отверстия. И так до бесконечности. На каждых 100 (метрах/километрах/etc.) скорость увеличивается. Такие дела.

[h1]Что понравилось:[/h1]

♥ [u]Стиль.[/u] Игра в стиле минимализма. Нет ничего лишнего, здесь только частица, стенки и коллайдер. Ничего отвлекающего.
♥ [u]Саунд.[/u] Неплохой, даже очень. Но всё же я катал под свое музло.
♥ [u]Цена.[/u] 79 руб. А по скидке руб 20. Неплохо.
♥ [u]Карточки.[/u] Стоит отметить, что в этой игре карты ОЧЕНЬ дорогие, некоторые доходят до 30р за штуку. Так у меня игра и окупилась, брал за 40, а карт продал на 66. Шикарно.
♥ [u]Достижения.[/u] Очень простые. Очень.
♥ [u]Таблица рекордов.[/u] Есть некий топ из 10 человек, обновляющийся каждую неделю, оказавшиеся там получат монетки =).
♥ [u]Сложность.[/u] Чем больше разгоняемся, тем больше скорость. Дальше самый хард.

[h1]Что не понравилось:[/h1]

♦ [u]Открытие ачив.[/u] Ачивы записываются после выхода из игры.
♦ [u]Быстро наскучит.[/u]

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Ачивохантерам самый что ни на есть маст хев, ачивы легкие, цена позволяет. Кому ачивы неважны, тоже рекомендую, ну карты продадите. Мне игра понравилась, покупать или нет решать вам =).

С уважением, Aikiro, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators] Ораторы Ste@m [/url]

Bardzo prosta gra, w której naszym zadaniem jest nie zderzenie się z nadlatującymi przeszkodami, które zwiększają swoją prędkość wraz z naszym wynikiem.

Co zaskakujące przegrana nie jest denerwująca i jedyne co po niej odczuwamy to smutek, że Soundtrack się skończył.
Ale po zderzeniu nie musimy koniecznie zaczynać grę od nowa, ponieważ możemy 3 razy wskrzesić się za żetony, które zbieramy podczas rozgrywki (pierwsze wskrzeszenie kosztuje 5, drugie 20, a trzecie 50).

Po osiągnieciu odpowiedniego wyniku kolor pozimou zmienia się oraz dostajemy 'checkpoint' (są one umieszczone co 100 punktów wyniku np. 100, 200, 300, 400 itd.).
Oznacza to, że z ekranu menu możemy zacząć grę właśnie od niego (zaczynamy odrazu z wynikiem np. 500)

Gra niestety ma również wady jak:
-bardzo krótki czas przejścia całej gry na 100% (zrobiłem to w ok. 10 - 15 min.)
-mało wymagające achievmenty (nie licząc Perfect 1300)
-achievmenty dostajemy dopiero po wyjściu z gry

Ale ogólnie rzecz biorąc gra jest warta swojej ceny i każdemu polecam w nią zagrać :)

16886423.review:
[h1]◆ 反射神経チェックゲー[/h1]
回転する壁の穴めがけて
マウスドラッグで狙いを定めて通過していくだけのゲーム。
進むにつれて100レベル刻みでスピードが増していく。
100レベルごとの地点からリスタートできるので
サクサク進めていけるし、穴通過時に取れるコインの枚数次第で
その場で3回までリトライもできる（3枚→20枚→50枚）。

[h1]◆ 全実績解除が容易[/h1]
実績的には1300レベル到達が目標となる。
プレイヤーの反射神経次第だが決して難しくはない。
コインが尽きてもすぐに補充していけるし
トライアンドエラーを繰り返していればどうとでもなる。
自分の場合は全実績解除まで30分ほどだった。
「一度もリトライせずに～～」みたいな糞面倒な実績がないのは
良心的と見るべきか生ヌルいと見るべきか。
なお、1300レベル以降もゲームは続いていくので
人間の限界に挑戦してみるのも一興。

[h1]◆ クソゲーと言えばクソゲー[/h1]
如何せんボリューム不足なので
『手軽に全実績解除できてトレカももらえる』
という以上のモノは求めるべきではないという総評。
SuperHexagonやVelociboxで心が折れた人が
精神的安定を取り戻して立ち直る用途としては有用。

[u][b]Fun, Fast-Paced, and Casual[/b][/u]

The Collider is a simple arcade game where you use your mouse to control the white dot in the center. The goal is to get as far as possible by controlling the dot to get through the holes, and moving obstacles. I highly reccomend this game, but I would suggest buying during a sale though. I didn't put in enough time for it to be worth $3, but you might, depending on what you use the game for.

[u][b]Uses:[/b][/u]

There are several ways to utilize this game. Here are some examples.

[list]
    [*]Great for killing time

    [*]Pure enjoyment, as the game itself is really fun.
    [*]Easy game to get all achievements for perfect games
[/list]

The game is simple (recommend turning mouse sensitivity all the way up or close) aim the white dot on the hole you want to go threw. Basically you go threw holes collecting coins and trying not to hit the solid part of the obstacles, as you do this you are constantly speeding up (you start at 100 speed). The fact that they have a leader boards is gratifying to know that all the hard effort you have done went towards something. Coins are not that important from my understanding the only real use for them is if you do hit the solid part of the obstacle you can repair and continue where you left off (from my understanding you only get 3 repairs). I recommend this game for sure, trading cards, achievements, and pure bi polar fun/rage. Have a friend that gets mad easy this is the game to get him, or a friend who likes a some what puzzle game and or would like to kill some time.

15460723.review:
First off and foremost I'll name the good things about this game: If you like games to challenge your friends to play, this is a decent one. It's cheap, starts off slow but gets going and has pleasent music paired with pretty colors. Gameplay is simple: get through the holes without crashing. There is a weekly tournament held for retry coins that you can also earn in-game. It's not Pay2Win. I've never played a game quite like this and I must say it's nice to take a break from shooters, RTS and open world sandbox style games. Basically, it's a good way to waste an hour or two.

With that said, why do I not recommend The Collider? Well at the risk of sounding like a broken record: "Basically, it's a good way to waste an hour or two." There is no replay value whatsoever. The highest speed you can start at is 1300 even if you get up to 1400 speed. After you reach your peak there isn't really a good reason to keep playing. There are no "levels" in the traditional sense. The color of the track changes as the speed increases but thats it. There are no characters, no story, no other game modes to play - NOTHING. You could challenge yourself to get all the Achievements but, they do not unlock. AT ALL. EVER! I've seen other people have this problem since at least November of 2014 and people still are having this problem now in April of 2015. I'd say any chance of a fix is long gone by now. I would only suggest buying this game if you have a coupon for it as a way to increase your steam rank. Otherwise it's not even worth the $2.99 asking price.

EXTRA COMMENTS: I have no clue how fast we are going. 1300 MPH? 1300 KPH? 1300 Light-years per hour? In my personal opinion I'd rather spend $2.99 on a pack of gum. I'd get more use out of the gum than this game. Thank goodness for that 90% off coupon, only cost me 30 cents.

I am editing my review to help others. For the ones who have problems with the achievements not unlocking I found a way to unlock them easily and found other tricks too.


If you make a run up to let say for example 800 and crash for the first time, do not repair but rather simply press esc right after crashing to get to the menu then press ALT+F4 which will hard stop the game and the achievement will popup.

Also I notice by accident that you can actually start your games from your last checkpoint! I did a test where I was at 1200 without crashing so I started from that point by pressing forward on the menu top screen, you will see that you can change the starting point. I did a run from 1200 to 1300 without crashing then did crash and did the ESC then ALT+F4 and the achievement for 1300 without crashing unlocked?

実績乞食必携！マウスエイムで迫り来る壁の穴を通り抜けるだけのゲーム！

ギミックは壁の回転ぐらいなもので、あとはスピードが徐々に早くなっていくだけの単純なゲーム。
シンプルが故にSuper HexagonやらVelociboxやらよりも単純に反射神経を求められる。
というかランキングを見る限り普通の人間は行けて1400くらいなんじゃないかと。

壁に当たってもコインを消費して最大三回(5→20→50枚)そこの地点からリトライができます。
それに加え、クリアした速度を100刻みで選びそこから開始できるので1200ぐらいまではスイスイ進みます。

実績で求められる最高速度が1300なので、ちょっと頑張ればいつの間にか全実績解除になってます。
ちなみにプレイ中に解除されるのではなく一度終了したときに解除判定される模様。
20分ばかし遊んで終了したときに一気に全実績解除されたのでびっくりしました。

肝心のプレイ感はというと、狭くてカラフルなチューブの中を高速でかっ飛んでいくのでなかなかにドラッギー。
最高速度は早々に頭打ちになると思うので、０からリトライ無しでどこまでいけるかとか縛りプレイするとより楽しいのではないかと思われます。

15083610.review:
The Collider places you inside of a particle accelerator that shoots you to incredibly fast speeds. The object of the game is to get as far along as you can before crashing. As you move along at dizzying speeds, you collect coins while avoiding obstacles. The coins can be used to revive you when you crash (which will be very often) up to three times in a round, which ends up being very helpful once you get farther along in the accelerator. There is a nice variety of obstacles, but I sometimes wish there were more.

The sound is okay, but not something I would want to listen to for long. Luckily, there is a mute button, so this isn't a problem. You can just rock out to whatever you want, while improving your reflex skills.

There's not much to The Collider, but it's definitely worth picking up if you like racing games. It's also nice for achievement hunters, since it only take a little bit of time to unlock them all. Be sure to get it while it's on sale, for that's when you'll be happiest with your purchase.

I just spent short entertaining moment to 'finish' the game, but it's enough for me to guarantee some enjoyment for you playing this. 15-20 mins are enough, it's a cheap bundle fodder anyway. Not to mention I can complete the achievement set easily, it's a bonus.

This is another version of Super Hexagon, can be infuriating especially when you fail the last distance to get the next checkpoints but hey... it's a part of the game. You will auto move forward and your job is to get as far as you can without hitting the obstacle in FPS mode - think of FPS racing except you don't have rival around you. Each 100 distance mark will earn you checkpoints, of which you can replay from the point onward to get even further. The last required distance is 1300 (as in checkpoint and achievement), so after that there's little to zero replay value.

Be warned, though, there have been reports of achievements failing to pop up, although there's a workaround found by players already. And there's silence from the developer, so if you see his future title, consider of his abandonment of this title also before purchasing.

Score: 7/10

14925049.review:
I just bought 'The Collider' last night on sale for $1.01. Great purchase!

It is a fun, simple, and unique game in the arcade/racing genre.

The basic jist of the game is that you are a particle in a particle accelerator. (excuse my lack of knowledge of science)

You use only the mouse to control the particle through various obstacles in the accelerator.

The game has great speed and could compare to other games like wipEout or F-Zero.

It is pretty addicting and I find myself constantly clicking the 'play again' button.

I did however notice various patterns of obstacles after 40 or 50 minutes of gameplay. It became a bit repetitive.

Also repetitive was the song used when playing. There is only ONE! 

It would be nice if there was more variance of gameplay like different types of levels, more music tracks, and more patterns of obstacles. 

Overall, 'The Collider' is a good game that I enjoyed and thus will recommend. It is a little repetitive, but stangely addicting.

7/10

P.S. I wouldn't pay more than a couple bucks for this one, so wait until a sale comes around :)

If you enjoy Super Hexagon, you'll likely enjoy [b]The Collider[/b] too. It is very simple and easy to control, but is incredibly fast paced, very challenging and very fun, it's also another of those games with a great soundtrack.

14466414.review:
[h1]Описание игры:[/h1]
Очередная игра, пришедшая к нам с мобильных платформ. Она примитивна настолько, что нам не придется даже нажимать на кнопки, а лишь двигать мышью. Вся игра состоит из того, что мы летим по коридору набирая скорость и собирая монетки и конечно нам нельзя врезаться в препятствия. Врезаясь мы три раза можем возродиться за те самые собранные монетки. С каждым повышением скорости на 100 меняется цвет комнаты и препятствия немного усложняются.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ В игре есть межплатформенный рейтинг (андроид, яблоко и стим).
¥ Первые 10 мест в регулярно проводимом турнире получают награды монетками (надо проехать со скоростью выше остальных игроков среди всех платформ)
¥ Легко получить достижения.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет какого-то разнообразия в препятствиях. 
¥ Достижения выдавались только после выхода из игры сразу кучей.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Неплохой порт мобильной игры, на один раз. После выполнения достижений интерес к игре был потерян. Рекомендовал бы я игру? Скорее да, чем нет.

[h1]Оценка:
5 из 10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

14350686.review:
Let me say this straight and simple: If you are going to buy this game, you are going to buy this game because of the incredible ease it takes to obtain all the achievements. It takes most about 20-60 minutes to do this, and even still many people have difficulty getting the achievements validated. Look to the forums if you have problems, the solutions are there.

The reason why I put this as thumbs down is because there is a free (and much better) game that is like this one on Kongregate. It is called Accelerator, here's the link http://www.kongregate.com/games/TenebrousP/accelerator.

The main differences between this one that you are paying money for and the free one are the sounds, visual, and a few game play differences. Accelerator has a much better sound system, but no music. It doesn't need it. It ends up giving a much better atmosphere than Collider without the music. Also complimenting the atmosphere are the visuals. There are no drastic colour changes besides the square tunnels being blue. This gives the game a more stream lined sense, and helps the progression without accidentally crashing.

While this isn't a problem in Collider because of the reviving function, Accelerator doesn't have that. it is much more harder because of this and you feel like you have actually achieved something. What Accelerator does have is a difficulty setting, and this changes one thing mainly, the level design. Harder difficulty levels will result in tight corners and diverging paths, which when you are going fast, become really difficult to traverse. It just adds to the feel of satisfaction when you get that impossible badge for reaching a speed of 1000.

All in all, my basic gripe was paying for this. Yes it is cheap, yes it gave me a perfect achievement thing, but in all honesty, why play this when Accelerator on Kongregate is free and so much better?

13435476.review:
The Collider is a pretty basic speed running game. While you're not actually running but rather flying, you start off slow and it gradually gets faster and faster until you end up crashing into a wall. The only other mechanic is that you are able to use coins that you collect to buy yourself a reset. The cost goes up until eventually you use up all your lives and have to start over.

At specifics speeds the game provides checkpoints up until a certain point so you don't have to waste unnecessary time to get back up to the speed where you were at before your game ended. If you do however manage to last from the start up until around where the last checkpoint is, the music will stop.

I would also get into that I was a bit surprised to only really see a single level that was not really up to much variation. I would be lying if I said it got repetitive as I did not play the game long enough for it to be so. This game would greatly benefit from extra levels and variety to add to the longevity. The game currently lasts under an hour of gameplay. I completed all of the achievements for this game and consider this game essentially complete. The amount of time the game lasts is not really all that long but at a price of $2.99 it does not appear to be a great value when compared to some other titles. The high scores or tournament type system at the end of each game that pop up also feels like you can never really benefit from winning because the game does not last more than a night.

The ultimate question however is about the fun factor. I cannot say that I did not have fun. I had a pretty good time for the short time that I played this game. There aren't any deal breakers and I definitely do not feel like I wasted my money. Even then, it might be worth picking up just to get all the achievements if you're into that kind of thing.

13136130.review:
[i]The Collider[/i] is an odd reflex game. It's along the same lines as [i]Super Hexagon[/i] in that it's addictive and high-energy, but is basically a flash game.

The objective here is to guide a small dot in the center of your monitor through an infinitely long tube comprised of screens with holes in it; you hit a screen, you die. The ultimate goal is to survive as long as possible. If you can guess, the game is rather punishing: expect to die a lot and make very little progress.

The achievements are very wonky and unlock all at once after you quit the game. It took me all of 19 minutes of gameplay to get them all without trying--so there's that.

In conclusion, other than demanding intense focus and quick reflexes, this game doesn't offer a lot of playtime. There are no special modes or items--just the base game. It's interesting the first few times around, but definitely not worth $3. Maybe try it if it's on sale and you have an extra quarter lying around, but otherwise, skip it.

Surprisingly engaging game, good for longer sessions and as a break from other, more sofisticated titles. Sensation of speed is taking you over quite early and it holds onto you for a whole duration of the game. 
As far as mechanics go, game is very simple - you just manouever with your mouse to avoid hitting the obstacles while velocity increases. No clicking or keys involved. Just a movement, that's what this game is all about after all. And it's really engaging.
Graphics and sound are very minimalistic and raw - if you liked aesthetics of TRON movies, you will feel right at home with this one.

All in all, I like this game very much.

13020179.review:
Simple game about beautiful sense of speed.

Cons: Feels too empty. Would really like to see more content — some great music, in particular. There's really nothing to see, nowhere to go, it's just all about that START button.
Pros: It's very simple and kind of pleasing. Sense of a speeding tunnel is very fun and almost kind of soothing; it really feels like you're slightly up in the air and you're cutting through that endless abstract space. Game was very smooth and responsive for me, as Unity works great for that kind of 3D action.

Get on sale if you don't mind your games being very simple, Flashgames-simple.
It's pocket change and it kind of pays off.

P.S. And, by the way, achievements work just fine — I hope not only for me.

13019100.review:
If you're looking to pay up to 2 dollars to add another "perfect game" to your Steam Profile in literally 30 minutes on your lunchbreak (my actual experience with this game), then I guess you should pick this up.

Otherwise, once you've "completed" the game after reaching the oddly arbitrary "1300" speed threshold (1300 what? MPH? KPH? Scoville units?), there's just nothing else to do or any reason to keep playing it.

I'd say the replay value is abysmal but it's actually absent.
There's literally like a dozen (or maybe less?) of obstacles that pop up in front of you every now and then. I mean, I'm sorry, I meant to say that this game is "procedurally generated".
The only other thing that's supposed to add an edge to the gameplay is the coins, which are pointless. You can only use them to buy continues, and since you can get the "perfect/clean" playthrough achievements in 30 minutes anyway, you don't really need the coins and they're merely a distraction.

Verdict:
Possibly the most forgettable game I've ever played on Steam.
But, for those of you who need to bump up that 100% achievements count, sure why not, go nuts.

12913968.review:
I have always dreamed about becoming a proton moving at almost light speed inside a particle accelerator, and now I can re-create these dreams in this particle accelerator simulator game!
You play as a tiny white packet of protons which are stripped of all of their electrons inside a particle accelerator, or a "collider", as it is called, moving through certain obstacles, although a collider will not usually have such obstacles for the packet of protons to maneuver through, I will assume they are magnetic accelerators, as  maybe in a newer design I am not yet familiar with are already implemented in.
However, I was personally confused as to why there was only one proton shown, as normally, there would be "packets" of protons, consisting of roughly 100 billion protons per packets, with roughly 1500 packets. Although I take this as a mistake, I will not be to critical as this could of been a design choice, as having all this on your screen may be slightly distracting game-play wise.
I was also slightly dissappointed with the introduction, as I was really hoping to be able to traverse through different boosters, as this was the highlight of my particle accelerating fantasies. I was also very dissapointed with the lack of ending cutscenes, as I am still very curious as to what happens to the packet you are in control of. as there is no other protons to be able to collide with, I lost loads of fantasy filled nights thinking over the results of this specific collider. I was expecting there to be a cutscene at the end where you finally collide with another proton to cause many new particles or atoms to fling out so I could record the results. But maybe there will be a DLC, or even better, a sequel to the game which might show this.
Overall, I found this collider simulator very fun to play, although not very realistic, I had a great time achieving the fantasies I've always had.

12759537.review:
[i]The Collider[/i] is an extremely simple but also nicely entertaining game, focusing on racing at ever-increasing speed through a particle accelerator. Graphics are minimal but stylish and functional, sound is electronic and appropriate and the gameplay is simply fun. By finetuning mouse-speed it's possible to steer in the collider by making fine and controlled movements, which made me almost feel like being in that mad tube. The sensation of speed is cleverly reached, so mission accomplished.

Just one - to me serious - flaw: the achievements are completely broken. Many people have already complained about this on the Community Forum, but up till now no solution has been offered yet. Some may get them, so may not. Weird.

Edited: Thanks to the efforts of some players, a fix for the achievements has been found. Look at the discussion page, there is a thread called "Achievements", and the fix is being discussed there. It involves downloading a file from Microsoft, but it's nothing too complicated. The developers should have fixed this a long time ago, so I won't up my score for this.

Overall score: 7/10

Концепция «The Collider» на самом деле практически ничем особенным-то и не выделяется. Цель — лететь частицей или чем-угодно в огромном коллайдере с нарастающей скоростью, пролетая сквозь отверстия в преградах. В некоторых из отверстий находятся монеты. Управление: удобное. Нужна лишь мыщь для преодоления безгранных кружочков.
Графон: супер прост.

Насколько бы небыла примитивной, как Super Hexagon, игра, - она стоит своих денег и малого времени.(все равно берите на скидках)  
Рекомендую особенно ачив-хантерам.
p.s. очень, очень напомнило мне последние 2 уровня из SNES-версии "Star Wars: Return of the Jedi"

12466966.review:
The Collider - эта одна из тех игр, которую можно пройти за 5 минут, а можно мучаться в нее часами, проклиная всех и каждого из-за своих миллиметровых ошибок)

В игре мы являемся элементарной частицей, которую выгнали в коллайдер на прогулку, так сказать. Соответственно, наша цель - пройти как можно дальше, избегая по пути встречи с различными препятствиями. Почему-то, первое, что пришло в голову после запуска игры - это всеми известный уровень знаменитой игры BattleToads с полетом боевых жаб на воздушных мотоциклах, только с видом от первого лица))

Оформлена игра неплохо, красиво, контрастно. Однако, чем дольше играешь, тем сильнее понимаешь, что глазам скоро придет гитлер капут))) Эпилептикам бы не стал советовать, иногда мелькания действительно зашкаливают, особенно на скоростях выше 1000.

Из минусов отметил бы музыкальное сопровождение, которое надоедает практически сразу, однако это легко решается включением поверх игры своей любимой музыки. 

Вопреки частому мнению на топике игры, никаких проблем с засчитыванием достижений я не ощутил, все засчиталось, как надо. 

Резюмируя все вышесказанное, советую данную игру к покупке (лучше на распродаже, как и любую другую игру, ценник хоть и небольшой, но 2 доллара эта игра явно не стоит). 

П.С. И прошу вас, да что там, даже умоляю: НЕ МОРГАЙТЕ)

12383251.review: This is an enjoyable game, that is simple in nature yet hard to master.  Appropriately called 'an arcade game', you aim at the holes on spinning disks with your mouse-pointer while you go progessively faster and faster. For every 100 mph faster, the discs and background change color. Sometimes the disks spin around more than other times, adding extra challenge. There is electronic music that adds to the feel overall. Sometimes you'll find yourself laughing at how good you're doing, or the way the different colors add to the thrillride here, and it is fun, and even spellbinding. It's especially good for a few minutes at a time, and I also find it fun in-between games on days we play a few games on Steam, and I also found it gets you prepared for better focus in other games on those days...which is a bonus, really. If you're looking at this game and thinking about getting it, then by all means, go for it. The appeal stays over time, too.

12318954.review:
The Collider is a very short but immensely satisfying reflex game. You basically have to pass through obstacles without crashing while constantly increasing speed at a fixed rate. It's quite casual in the sense that you don't have to finish speed 100 to 1300 in one sitting. You can readjust the starting speed whenever you unlock a new one (which makes for quick and painless achievements). My only complaint with the game is that I somehow lost progress after reaching 1200. I tried to record the last stretch on Fraps and I'm not sure what happened during that time to trigger it. Thankfully, you can easily re-climb back to 1300 by using extra lives that cost coins. For all of you achievement hunters, don't use extra lives if you're trying to get the no-crash achievements. Whenever you crash, just go back to main menu and replay at the desired speed.

4/5. Very affordable and I definitely recommend it.

12314269.review: Its time to move the couch in front of the 70" TV,  get the box fans out, place strategically around the tv, turn on full blast, and play 'The Collider'. Don't forget the snacks as you're going to be playing for a while until you beat it. Yes, 'The Collider' has that essential element to it, that challenges you to beat it. It's a very simple but frustrating game. and forces you to play it until you have beaten it ! Its simple fun, and it apparently messes with time and space, as before you know it, you have either beaten it in an hour, and gotten another perfect game to show off on your profile, or you have spent most of the day in front of it, wandering why you can't quite make the last couple of achievements. The collider isn't very original, essentially a simplified 'Race The Sun', or perhaps 'AaAaAA!!! - A Reckless Disregard for Gravity' ... it isn't really that well done ...not many options, variety, or backing music but it works. The game is simply coded to consist of a narrow light tunnel which is constructed to give the impression of motion, with occasional twists and turns, obstacles are introduced which consist of disks with holes of varying shape and size blocking said tunnel, occasionally rotate through which you have to navigate. It has 13 levels which once beaten can be used as a starting point to continue in your efforts to complete the game. These save points make it easier to beat and greatly simplifies the pursuit of the 'perfect game'.  Its all about not blinking, turning up the mouse sensitivity, drinking coffee and getting those reflexes sharpened.... if you're like me and really really _REALLY_ old, its going to be really hard....and you will be writing reviews just to get a break! But if you're not out of elementary school you should be done in an hour. Don't think about it, buy this game, don't even waste time looking for a coupon on the forums... buy it now, play it now. You will enjoy.
